simulated_ratings.title: Alien (1979)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Oppressive, methodical space dread that's right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Aliens (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tense and propulsive, though the action tilt blunts some of the fear I crave.

simulated_ratings.title: The Thing (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, paranoid shapeshifter terror that gnaws at you.

simulated_ratings.title: The Descent (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Claustrophobic survival horror that squeezes the nerves.

simulated_ratings.title: The Orphanage (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tender, sorrowful haunting that trusts mood more than jump scares.

simulated_ratings.title: The Devil's Backbone (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A wartime ghost story where sorrow and menace quietly intertwine.

simulated_ratings.title: Pan's Labyrinth (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Myth and brutality entwine into something beautiful and bruising.

simulated_ratings.title: The Others (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dark-house suspense built on restraint and maternal fear.

simulated_ratings.title: Hereditary (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Family trauma curdled into oppressive, inescapable dread.

simulated_ratings.title: The Witch (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick supernatural action with little room for atmosphere.

simulated_ratings.title: It Follows (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A slight, pulpy chase setup that never quite chills.

simulated_ratings.title: The Babadook (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grief-as-monster metaphor that sustains a low, anxious hum.

simulated_ratings.title: Annihilation (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ideas-driven sci-fi with hypnotic, unsettling imagery.

simulated_ratings.title: Under the Skin (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quiet reunion drama that intrigues more than it grips me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Wailing (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slow-burn small-town terror with a creeping sense of doom.

simulated_ratings.title: A Tale of Two Sisters (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant psychological unease with a tragic undercurrent.

simulated_ratings.title: Ringu (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cold, investigative dread that seeps in rather than jumps out.

simulated_ratings.title: Pulse (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lonely, tech-tinged haunting that casts a soft, lingering chill.

simulated_ratings.title: Cure (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A measured, ambiguous nightmare that gets under the skin.

simulated_ratings.title: Noroi: The Curse (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Documentary-style unraveling that feels plausibly eerie and expansive.

simulated_ratings.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tight, contained mystery with escalating, eerie revelations.

simulated_ratings.title: The Ritual (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grief-tinged woodland dread with steady, mounting unease.

simulated_ratings.title: Under the Shadow (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: War-torn domestic haunting that feels grounded and tense.

simulated_ratings.title: Coherence (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A simple setup spirals into heady, unnerving what-ifs over dinner.

simulated_ratings.title: Moon (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intimate, humane sci-fi that quietly hit me hard.

simulated_ratings.title: Sunshine (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: High-stakes space mission suspense with striking, chilly grandeur.

simulated_ratings.title: The Innocents (1961)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant, suggestive haunting that favors atmosphere over shocks.

simulated_ratings.title: The Endless (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lo-fi cult mystery with a patient, cosmic unease.

simulated_ratings.title: Session 9 (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Patient, oppressive institutional dread that seeps under the skin.

simulated_ratings.title: The Lighthouse (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Claustrophobic and well-crafted, but its manic artfulness keeps me at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: Possession (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Marital breakdown spiraling into feverish, uncanny terror that hangs in the mind.

simulated_ratings.title: The Night House (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy mad-science antics smother the unease I’m after.

simulated_ratings.title: The Changeling (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant, grief-soaked haunting delivered with quiet, mounting chills.

simulated_ratings.title: Don't Look Now (1973)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mournful, uncanny grief that builds a persistent, uneasy shiver.

simulated_ratings.title: The Haunting (1963)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Suggestive, classic house-of-echoes terror that trusts shadows over shocks.

simulated_ratings.title: Dark Water (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Muted, damp J-horror melancholy with a steady, lingering chill.

simulated_ratings.title: Audition (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: An empty erotic clip-reel

simulated_ratings.title: The Wicker Man (1973)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Folk dread and ritual unease that tightens its grip scene by scene.

simulated_ratings.title: Kill List (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A crime spiral that slides into occult nightmare with grim inevitability.

simulated_ratings.title: The Borderlands (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Hints of the uncanny in the woods, but the pieces never fully cohere for me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Vast of Night (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lo-fi, late-night mystery that hums with eerie possibility.

simulated_ratings.title: Solaris (1972)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Somber, contemplative sci-fi that burrows into memory and guilt.

simulated_ratings.title: Triangle (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A taut, looping puzzle that maintains a moody, disorienting chill.

simulated_ratings.title: A Dark Song (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ritual horror rendered with patience and grave, accumulating weight.

simulated_ratings.title: The Empty Man (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Urban legend unease expanding into a chilly, cultish cosmic murmur.

simulated_ratings.title: The Medium (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Shamanic possession framed with grounded, slowly escalating dread.

simulated_ratings.title: Incantation (2022)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Curse mythology and found-footage textures that build a credible, creeping fear.

simulated_ratings.title: His House (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Human grief and displacement braided into a tense, haunting domestic nightmare.

simulated_ratings.title: The Dark and the Wicked (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak family doom steeped in relentless, oppressive atmosphere.

simulated_ratings.title: Apostle (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Remote-cult descent that’s grim and engrossing, if uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: The Blair Witch Project (1999)

simulated_ratings.title: The Exorcist III (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Procedural dread punctured by a few genuinely hair-raising moments.

simulated_ratings.title: Kuroneko (1968)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegiac vengeance ghost tale that casts a soft, spectral chill.

simulated_ratings.title: Onibaba (1964)

simulated_ratings.title: The Invitation (2015)

simulated_ratings.title: The House of the Devil (2009)

simulated_ratings.title: Prince of Darkness (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Metaphysical siege horror steeped in cold, cosmic unease.

simulated_ratings.title: The Fog (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A whispery coastal ghost story whose mood outweighs its bumps.

simulated_ratings.title: The Mist (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Oppressive, small-town paranoia with a mean, lingering aftertaste.

simulated_ratings.title: The Vanishing (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A calm, merciless slide into dread that left me hollow.

simulated_ratings.title: Repulsion (1965)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Suffocating apartment psychosis rendered with icy, creeping dread.

simulated_ratings.title: Rosemary's Baby (1968)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Paranoia and domestic control tightening into a quietly infernal trap.

simulated_ratings.title: Jacob's Ladder (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mourning and guilt warped into nightmarish, claustrophobic hallucination.

simulated_ratings.title: Angel Heart (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody occult noir that simmers more than it shocks, but it lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: The Serpent and the Rainbow (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Voodoo-tinted nightmare travelogue—atmospheric, if uneven and pulpy.

simulated_ratings.title: The Seventh Victim (1943)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Shadowy, melancholic occult mystery that whispers more than it screams.

simulated_ratings.title: The Eye (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clean, mournful J-horror chills with a steady, spectral thrum.

simulated_ratings.title: Shutter (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Guilt-haunted photo-horror with credible, creeping shivers.

simulated_ratings.title: Creepy (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Kiyoshi Kurosawa’s patient malaise curdling into domestic terror.

simulated_ratings.title: The Canal (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sour marital hauntings that stir unease even when the pieces wobble.

simulated_ratings.title: Resolution (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A wrestling PPV detour—miles from the slow-burn unease I’m after.

simulated_ratings.title: Possum (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, airless trauma-horror that crawls under the skin and stays.

simulated_ratings.title: Relic (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dementia as housebound haunting, tender and quietly suffocating.

simulated_ratings.title: The Lodge (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A jokey portmanteau that diffuses dread instead of deepening it.

simulated_ratings.title: The Legend of Hell House (1973)

simulated_ratings.title: The Tenant (1976)

simulated_ratings.title: Tigers Are Not Afraid (2017)

simulated_ratings.title: Halloween (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clean, patient slasher craft that lets suburban night air thicken into dread.

simulated_ratings.title: The Exorcist (1973)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Heavy, sacramental dread that builds from domestic anguish to numinous terror.

simulated_ratings.title: The Shining (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A cold, echoing maze of isolation and menace that works under the skin.

simulated_ratings.title: Cat People (1942)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Shadow-and-suggestion romance where the threat purrs from the edges.

simulated_ratings.title: I Walked with a Zombie (1943)
